frame.name: Emotions
frame.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Experiencer</fen> has a particular emotional <fen>State</fen>, which may be described in terms of a specific <fen>Stimulus</fen> that provokes it, or a <fen>Topic</fen> which categorizes the kind of <fen>Stimulus</fen>. Rather than expressing the <fen>Experiencer</fen> directly, it may (metonymically) have in its place a particular <fen>Event</fen> (with participants who are <fen>Experiencer</fen>s of the emotion) or an <fen>Expressor</fen> (a body-part of gesture which would give an indication of the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s state to an external observer).</def-root>

FE.name: Experiencer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
</def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs. It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Stimulus
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s emotion deviates from the norm for the emotion.
</def-root>

FE.name: Empathy_target
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Empathy_target</fen> is the individual or individuals with which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> identifies emotionally and thus shares their emotional response.
</def-root>

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The body part, gesture, or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state. They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> is the explanation for why the <fen>Stimulus</fen> evokes a certain emotional response. </def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> is the condition(s) under which the <fen>Stimulus</fen> evokes its response. In some cases it may appear without an explicit <fen>Stimulus</fen>. Quite often in such cases, the <fen>Stimulus</fen> can be inferred from the <fen>Circumstances</fen>
</def-root>

FE.name: State
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in. </def-root>

FE.name: Parameter
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Parameter</fen> is a domain in which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the way in which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the <fen>Stimulus</fen> which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). <fen>Manner</fen> may also describe a state of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that affects the details of the emotional experience. </def-root>
